result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie M. Donahue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Carrie M. Donahue was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carrie M. Donahue is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Carrie M. Donahue was found guilty of Causing Mental Harm to Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).
  • Carrie M. Donahue was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Carrie M. Donahue was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Carrie M. Donahue was found guilty of Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Atty Angela Conrad Kachelski appears on behalf of Ms. Donahue.  .  
This is on this morning for a decision by the Court on the deft's Motion for a New Trial based on ineffective assistance of counsel.

Two issues to discuss
1)  Audio visual recordings of:   MMD
Discussion concerning Sec. 908.08(4) and why defendants don't believe it is admissible. 
Argument by Attorneys Johnson, Ahmad and Dickinson.
Court asks how it can decide this at time without the evidence having been presented?
Response by Atty Johnson.

Court believes it has to review the video/audio recordings as to MMD before the Court can make a determination.

This issue should be addressed outside the presence of the Jury prior to photos being presented.
